If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.49-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exp https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1934/folder/15397164/57242436/1008394969 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsnoidjdosisjdios@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace settings > Reports. 3. Click Default report title. 4. Enter multiline text with some mark down. ## Expected Result: Default report title field should accept only single line title and will not render mark down because report title supports none of it (can confirm by creating a new report in workspace chat). ## Actual Result: Default report title field accepts multiline title and renders mark down. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/29e9fbaa-7a77-42cd-9e48-0c8c69556414 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cristipaval **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1762775311791349) ## Action Performed: 1. Have an account with multiple draft reports 2. Sign out and then sign back in (fresh session) 3. Immediately go to Global Create before performing any other actions 4. Start creating a new expense and proceed until the confirmation page 5. Click on the Report field to change the report where the expense should be added ## Expected Result: The Report field should be clickable, allowing the user to choose between existing draft reports. ## Actual Result: The Report field is not clickable — the user cannot select a different report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.48-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** htad26+eredsdswtyu@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a group chat with one user 3. In the group chat, split an expense of any amount 4. Navigate to the DM of the user you split the expense with 5. Return to the group chat, open the header, rename the group, and Save 6. Click Leave to exit the group ## Expected Result: The IOU report in the DM should display the correct expense amount ## Actual Result: An empty IOU report is displayed in the DM. The correct expense amount appears only after opening the transaction thread. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e2de70e3-6910-435b-ac75-bb0d92206ea9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Track expense - The data in the expense report is not updating after smart scanning failure

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.48-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1893/folder/13176877/41237360/1005353780?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** n/a **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.4.1 Safari, Desktop, iPhone 13 iOS 18.6.2 Safari, Hybrid **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Precondition; Account has a Self DM 1. Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to the Self DM 3. Track a scan expense with a random image as receipt to make smart scan failed 4. Click the expense preview while scanning 5. Wait until smart scanning fails ## Expected Result: After smart scanning fails, the amount and merchant fields are empty and have the error state displayed, a red dot should appear in the report chat in LHN. The expense header should be updated to "Receipt missing details" ## Actual Result: After smart scanning failure, there is a Concierge message, "Receipt scanning failed. Please enter the details manually", but the smart scan is still in progress (Receipt scanning is displayed in expense report header and LHN, and a scanning status is still displayed in the Amount and Merchant fields), the data is updated only after reopening expense report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95d96085-831e-45e7-94d5-cf2938f450fa [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
